title: Justice for Breonna Taylor - White House Petition
subtitle: Sign the White House petition to demand justice for Breonna Taylor.

title: Justice for George Floyd
subtitle: Reach the attention of Mayor Jacob Frey and DA Mike Freeman to beg to have the officers involved in this disgusting situation fired and for charges to be filed immediately.

title: The Minneapolis Police Officers to be charged for murder after killing innocent black man
subtitle: Stand up to the Minneapolis Police Department and demand that both officers are charged with murder and sentenced to the highest possible amount of time in Federal prison.

title: #JusticeforBre: Police officers who killed Breonna Taylor must be FIRED.
subtitle: Call for the three police officers responsible for the death of Breonna Taylor to be fired and charged for murder.

title: Fight for Breonna
subtitle: Breonna survived the frontlines of a pandemic that disproportionately kills Black people, only to have her life stolen by police. Take Action.

title: Call to demand justice for Breonna Taylor
subtitle: Call 502-735-1784 to tell key decision-makers that the police who murdered Breonna Taylor must be arrested immediately.

title: Defund12.org
subtitle: Email and mail government officials and council members to reallocate egregious police budgets towards education, social services, and dismantling racial injustice.

title: Email the mayor of Louisville
subtitle: Send a pre-filled email to Mayor Fischer of Louisville, KY to demand he holds the officers who killed Breonna Taylor accountable.

emailInfo.subject: Accountability for Breonna Taylor
emailInfo.messageBody:
Mayor Fischer,

Like thousands of people across the country, I was appalled to hear about Breonna Taylor's murder on March 13th. Echoing the requests of Louisville community organizers, the following demands must be met to ensure that the officers responsible for Breonna's death are held accountable for their brash, reprehensible actions:

  1. Your office and the Louisville City Council must address the use of force by the Louisville Metro Police
  2. The officers that killed Breonna (Sgt. Jonathan Mattingly, Detective Brett Hankison, and Detective Myles Cosgrove) must be fired, and have their pensions revoked
  3. Ensure that all necessary information is provided to a local, independent civilian community police accountability council
  4. Create policy for a transparent investigation process due to law enforcement misconduct
  5. Appoint a special prosecutor to bring forward charges against the officers and oversee all parts of this case

It is imperative that you condemn the actions of these officers. Raids cannot be performed with a shoot first, ask questions later mentality. Too many lives have been lost this way, and too often "danger" is determined by deeply entrenched racial biases, not actual threat level.

It is a tragedy that Breonna Taylor is not alive today. Police must be held to a higher standard than this. I trust that your office and the involved parties will do the right thing.

Sincerely,

[Your name] from [Your location]

title: Justice for Julius Jones
subtitle: Julius Jones is on death row in Oklahoma, despite maintaining his innocence and compelling evidence that he was wrongfully convicted. Send an email to express your support of his release.

emailInfo.subject: Justice for Julius Jones
emailInfo.messageBody:
Dear Oklahoma Pardon & Parole Board members,

I strongly feel that Julius Darius Jones (# 270147) was wrongfully convicted of murder and sentenced to death in 2002. A crime for which he has always maintained his innocence.

Jones, a black 19 year old man, was arrested in 1999 for shooting white insurance executive Paul Scott Howell in Edmond, Oklahoma. At the time of his arrest, Julius was a successful athlete and honor student on scholarship at the University of Oklahoma.

Recently, new evidence of racial bias in the Jones’ case has been uncovered by the ABC documentary, “The Last Defense.”

One day after the documentary finale aired (7-25-18), the Oklahoma Criminal Court of Appeals released a document indicating they could take a look at the Jones’ case.

There are many factors that were overlooked and never presented during the Julius Jones trial.
1. Jones’ attorney during the trial was inexperienced by his own admission and this was his first death penalty case.
2. Several key pieces of evidence were never presented to the jury.
3. Tunnel vision set in and the police and prosecutor ignored evidence pointing to others as the shooter.
4. The court ignored an alleged racial statement made by one of the jurors
5. The jury judged Jones based on his race.
After viewing the recent ABC documentary, “The Last Defense,” I am even more convinced than ever of Julius’ innocence and that he should be given a new trial. I also ask that District Attorney David Prater release Julius Jones’ case files to his attorneys in order to promote public trust in both the criminal justice system and in Julius Jones’s case.

We all have all heard the phrase ‘beyond a shadow of doubt.’ To me, there is more than a shadow of doubt in this case.

Please, I ask that you do whatever is within your power to support Julius Jones’ Clemency Petition and see that this injustice – the wrongful conviction of Julius Jones – is overturned.

Thank you,
[Your Name]
[Your location]

title: Protect Protestors from Federal Officers
subtitle: The goal of this petition is to stop federal officers from detaining protestors in Portland, Oregon. These officers are arresting peaceful protestors in unmarked vehicles without identifying themselves. Gov. Kate Brown has described this as a "blatant abuse of power".

title: Justice for George Floyd
subtitle: Text JUSTICE to 668366 to demand every cop involved in the murder of George Floyd be charged without bail.

title: Justice for George Floyd
subtitle: Text FLOYD to 55156 to demand every cop involved in the murder of George Floyd be charged without bail.

title: Justice for Breonna Taylor
subtitle: Text ENOUGH to 55156 to demand that the officers involved in the murder of Breonna Taylor be charged.

title: Justice for Toyin Salau
subtitle: Oluwatoyin “Toyin” Salau was a 19-year old black woman whose life was tragically taken by an unknown man. Salau was an avid protestor for the Black Lives Matter movement, and was also battling homelessness.

title: Tell Congress to protect Black voters
subtitle: The ability to vote for people and policies that respect Black lives has always been a matter of life and death. But this year, certain accommodations for voters are urgently needed to protect our health and our rights from the COVID-19 outbreak and increases in violent rhetoric and behavior targeting Black people.

title: Ban or Restrict Tear Gas
subtitle: The use of tear gas has been banned and is illegal in war. This same tear gas is used by the law enforcement, to control unarmed crowds protesting for the BLM movement. Tear gas is also used for border control and is thrown at innocent migrants who are unarmed and pose no sudden threat to anyone in the vicinity.

title: Reopen Sandra Bland's Case
subtitle: Sandra Bland was arrested for a traffic stop on July 10, 2015 by Brian Encinia.  She was found dead in her cell three days later. Encinia was never indicted, in spite of the fact, that he physically assaulted her her on camera. There is a new video that has come to light, which may have been hidden from the grand jury.

title: Classify White Supremacist Groups as Domestic Terrorist Organizations
subtitle: Request a new legal requirement to register, classify, and subsequently surveil white supremacist organizations as domestic terrorist organizations. By classifying these groups as intimidating to the American population and dangerous to human life, the institutions responsible for protecting citizens against such groups will have the necessary information and resources to prevent further destruction carried out by these violent terrorist groups.

title: Justice for the Murder of Rayshard Brooks
subtitle: Rayshard Brooks, an unarmed, 27 year old Black man was murdered after 3 officers responded to complaints of him sleeping in his vehicle in the Wendy’s parking lot. After struggling with the officers, Brooks began to run for his life, when he was shot in the back more than once.

title: End Police Militarization and Over-Policing
subtitle: The tragic and unnecessary killings of George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, Tony McDade – and countless Black people at the hands of law enforcement – confirms what we've known for too long: Lawmakers must take serious action to fix the racist policing systems in our country.

title: Abolish Prison Labor in the USA
subtitle: Prison labor is a form of modern American slavery used by multiple large corporations across the world. Under the 13th Amendment to the United States Constitution, slavery was merely reformed rather than abolished. Racial justice in the USA cannot be achieved until prison labor is abolished completely.

title: Justice for Tete Gulley
subtitle: Tete Gulley was a 31 year old queer Black transient. She was also known by some of her family as Otis. She was found hanging from a tree on the evening of May 27th 2019 in Rocky Butte Park. The cause of death was determined to be suicide at the scene but there is evidence of foul play.

title: Abolish The Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights
subtitle: Officers should not be held above the law or its people, they should not be given special immunity and neither should the government. We should not fear our government, elected officials, military and law enforcement officers. Everyone should be held accountable for their actions.

title: Justice for Dominique Fells
subtitle: June 9th, another black trans woman named Dominique Fells was murdered and thrown in a river. The violence against black trans women needs to stop. We cannot allow for the murder of this young woman to go unpunished.

title: Justice for Lakeith Smith
subtitle: Lakeith Smith, now 20, was charged with the murder of his friend, A’Donte Washington when he was only 15— a crime he did not commit. A'donte died at the hands of a policeman, after the police fired 4 rounds into him - and he currently walks free.

title: Justice For Tony McDade
subtitle: Tony McDade was a transgender black man who got killed by police in Tallahassee. Sign this petition and encourage others to do so as well to get his name out there.
